factions.name: Aliens
factions.description: Return minions to their owners' hands, gain victory points instantly, and manipulate bases.

factions.name: Dinosaurs
factions.description: Play high-powered minions and actions with some protection and destruction.

factions.name: Ninjas
factions.description: Destroy minions and actions, and sneak onto bases at the last second using special abilities.

factions.name: Pirates
factions.description: Move around from base to base and destroy weak minions, usually several at the same time.

factions.name: Robots
factions.description: Play several weak minions in a single turn, often with power bonuses or useful abilities.

factions.name: Tricksters
factions.description: Force other players to discard and make bases undesirable to play on.

factions.name: Wizards
factions.description: Draw and play extra cards each turn, especially actions.

factions.name: Zombies
factions.description: Play minions directly from the discard pile or retrieve discarded cards into your deck/hand.

factions.name: Bear Cavalry
factions.description: Move other players' minions away from bases you have minions on, and destroy moving minions.

factions.name: Ghosts
factions.description: Can shrink hand size and gain benefits from having 2 or fewer cards in your hand.

factions.name: Killer Plants
factions.description: Play extra minions, usually straight from the deck, and grow more powerful on bases through multi-turn abilities.

factions.name: Steampunks
factions.description: Play powerful base actions that can be salvaged from the discard pile, and move your minions between bases.

factions.name: Elder Things
factions.description: This faction gives Madness to other players, and has strong minions that are difficult to play.

factions.name: Innsmouth
factions.description: Ten copies of the same power-2 minion and actions that benefit your weak minions and those that have the same name as each other.

factions.name: Cthulhu Cultists
factions.description: Play lots of actions, recover cards from the discard pile, and slow the game down all the while gaining Madness.

factions.name: Miskatonic University
factions.description: Gain, use, and lose Madness to accomplish a little of everything.

factions.name: Cyborg Apes
factions.description: Play lots of actions on minions to power them up.

factions.name: Shapeshifters
factions.description: Copy other players' power and abilities, destroy and replace your minions.

factions.name: Super Spies
factions.description: Sabotage other players' hands and deck while improving yours, and play specials while bases are scoring.

factions.name: Time Travelers
factions.description: Replay actions and minions, and avoid the discard pile by placing cards in your hand or the bottom of your deck.

factions.name: Giant Ants
factions.description: Weak minions with lots of +1 power counters that can flexibly move and allocate them.

factions.name: Mad Scientists
factions.description: Play lots of +1 power counters, and gain bonuses for removing +1 power counters.

factions.name: Vampires
factions.description: Destroy your and others' minions to gain +1 power counters.

factions.name: Werewolves
factions.description: Minions with strong but temporary power bursts, bonuses based on power, and destruction.

factions.name: Fairies
factions.description: Choose between effects and counter actions played on minions and bases.

factions.name: Kitty Cats
factions.description: Weaken other players' minions, temporarily take control of weak minions, and destroy minions you control.

factions.name: Mythic Horses
factions.description: Play multiple minions in a turn with bonuses for having multiple minions on the same base.

factions.name: Princesses
factions.description: Six power-5 minions with powerful talents and ongoing abilities, and a diverse assortment of supporting actions revolving around moving minions around, card draw and card retrieval.

factions.name: Clerics
factions.description: Return cards from the discard pile and prevent cards from going to the discard pile.

factions.name: Dwarves
factions.description: Gain and play treasures to boost the power of your minions.

factions.name: Elves
factions.description: Help other players to indirectly help yourself at the right moment.

factions.name: Halflings
factions.description: Draw many minions, play many minions and put minions on top of your deck.

factions.name: Mages
factions.description: Discard cards for benefits, such as power gain, minion destruction, extra cards, and monster manipulation.

factions.name: Orcs
factions.description: Brute force against your opponents with bonuses for having more power than others.

factions.name: Thieves
factions.description: Steal action cards in play, gain treasures, and sell treasures for benefits, such as VPs, power gain, and minion destruction.

factions.name: Warriors
factions.description: Play and destroy monsters on bases to manipulate the breakpoint and gain treasures.

factions.name: Dragons
factions.description: Manipulate bases and make them unattractive for other players with your presence.

factions.name: Mythic Greeks
factions.description: Get bonus power from playing the diverse "favors of the gods" (= actions).

factions.name: Sharks
factions.description: Move around and destroy weaker minions to get +1 power counters and extra minion plays.

factions.name: Superheroes
factions.description: Morph your weak minions into power-5-or-more minions.

factions.name: Tornados
factions.description: Move minions, move your own minions, move other players' minions.

factions.name: Astroknights
factions.description: Ten unique minions that focus on drawing and playing actions that directly increase minion power.

factions.name: Changebots
factions.description: Mobile faction where minions switch between having higher power and utilizing abilities.

factions.name: Ignobles
factions.description: Give control of your minions to others for benefits, often before taking them back.

factions.name: Star Roamers
factions.description: Return your minions to hand for benefits, and manipulate how your minions are affected, like moving them instead of returning them or having your power-2 minions be affected instead of others.

factions.name: Explorers
factions.description: Manipulate the next bases of the base deck, move/play extra minions on new bases to take early leads, and move minions all over the place.

factions.name: Grannies
factions.description: Manipulate your deck, draw/play actions from the top of your deck and draw/play minions from the bottom of your deck.

factions.name: Rock Stars
factions.description: Collect Groupies, gain advantages from bases with high breakpoints, play and move many minions at once to break bases.

factions.name: Teddy Bears
factions.description: Low power minions who rise in power to challenge opponents, with actions focused on neutralizing enemy threats and drawing more cards.

factions.name: Itty Critters
factions.description: Play weak extra minions that go under your deck at the end of the turn.

factions.name: Kaiju
factions.description: Gain power through your play-on-base actions and destroy other players' cards.

factions.name: Magical Girls
factions.description: Abilities that get better the more minions you have on the same base.

factions.name: Mega Troopers
factions.description: Special abilities that can help you during the scoring of bases.

factions.name: Disco Dancers
factions.description: Duplicate the effects caused by standard actions, thus increasing the number of affected minions.

factions.name: Kung Fu Fighters
factions.description: Generate +1 power counters, drain them from any player's minions and destroy weaker minions.

factions.name: Truckers
factions.description: Use play-on-base actions as vehicles to move themselves and gain power, and mess with other players' play-on-base actions.

factions.name: Vigilantes
factions.description: A group of seven power-4 minions with powerful and oppressive abilities, including hard removal, power boost and retaliation.

factions.name: Geeks
factions.description: Use your knowledge of the game to disrupt other players' plans.

factions.name: Smash Up All Stars
factions.description: Draw and retrieve cards from your deck and discard pile to get your best cards out as soon as possible and keep them around for as long as possible.

factions.name: Ancient Egyptians
factions.description: Bury cards for use in the future and gain benefits from burying and uncovering cards.

factions.name: Cowboys
factions.description: Start duels with other players' minions, and boost your own power to win duels.

factions.name: Samurai
factions.description: Give you various benefits whenever your minions go to the discard pile from play.

factions.name: Vikings
factions.description: Steal other players' cards and gain power at the cost of placing cards from your hand on the top of your deck.

factions.name: Luchadors
factions.description: They’re going to the top rope! The Luchadors bring the high-flying stunts of Mexican wrestling to the Smash Up squared-circle!

factions.name: Mounties
factions.description: Turn of the century Canada *cue silent film piano*… the Great White North is protected by the noble Mounties and their… battle moose! The Mounties always get their man, no matter how devious, all while upholding the noble demeanor of Canada.

factions.name: Musketeers
factions.description: One for all, and all for one! Or three! Or really four, because there were four of them, but we’ll ignore that, just like the title of the book! The Musketeers were the super heroes of Renaissance France, taking on corrupt elements with style and panache.

factions.name: Sumo Wrestlers
factions.description: The powerful sumo wrestlers of Japan can really throw their weight around the bases! These massive warriors can knock back any enemies that come against them, but don’t let their initial girth fool you. They will sacrifice cards for power, and use that power to knock all opponents out of the ring … and base!

factions.name: Russian Fairy Tales
factions.description: These minions are frequently transformed!

factions.name: West Africa
factions.description: Sharing stories and cards is valued!

factions.name: Germany
factions.description: Uniting characters from the same tale gives benefits!

factions.name: Inca Empire
factions.description: Known for roads and monumental architecture!

factions.name: Polynesians
factions.description: Spreading out to as many islands as possible!

factions.name: Sheep
factions.description: These are the AEG Sheep!

factions.name: Penguins
factions.description: This is the 2019 promotional Smash Up Faction - the Penguins!

factions.name: Avengers
factions.description: The Avengers faction assembles six mighty heroes whose different skills can handle any situation. Each has a signature action that can be used at any time, but is stronger when used with its hero. Though their numbers are few, they have several ways to cycle through their deck and recycle discarded cards to get what they need when they need it.

factions.name: Hydra
factions.description: Cut off one head and two shall take its place! Hydra is not afraid of character destruction since it makes them stronger, especially when their leaders order it. Hydra characters can overrun a base, and since they have several ways to swell their numbers, it won't be long until they are ready for more conquests.

factions.name: Kree
factions.description: The Kree are an advanced militaristic race who strike down their foes with ruthless efficiency. Their strengths are in extra action play, additional power, and card draw. Their cards can be deployed for either long-term advantage or for devastating combos.

factions.name: Masters of Evil
factions.description: The Masters of Evil seek to control the world through any means! In addition to the VP rewards from bases, they've developed alternate methods of getting VPs, and they get stronger the more VPs they have. They are also good at destroying characters, to slow other players, and increase their strategic gain.

factions.name: S.H.I.E.L.D.
factions.description: S.H.I.E.L.D. carefully monitors the world and stands ready to jump in to stop their foes. Its agents excel at both calling in extra characters for help and strengthening each other. Careful planning allows them to play cards in the right order to maximize their assets.

factions.name: Sinister Six
factions.description: The Sinister Six love to prey on weakness. They have many ways to make bases weak, and get many benefits from weaker bases. They have several base modifiers and ways to reuse them and their characters. Since they make base breaking easier, they need to be careful to have the most power there when it happens.

factions.name: Spider-Verse
factions.description: Web-slinging heroes from parallel universes have come together in a common fight to protect their neighborhoods. They specialize in swinging in before and after bases score to sway things in their favor -- as long as they have someone already there. But they can be even stronger when they join forces during their own turn, so they can be busy no matter whose turn it is.

factions.name: Ultimates
factions.description: The Ultimates patrol the universe looking for cosmic threats. They are strong in movement, and movement makes them stronger. They also work well together, so they can spread out, and then unite as a powerful team where the need is greatest.

factions.name: Goblins
factions.description: This is the 2021 promotional Smash Up Faction - the Goblins!
